availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Boswell. Father of John Boswell, William Boswell, and Elizabeth "Bettie" Boswell. Postmaster of Leesburgh, Harrison County, from July 3, 1841, to March 16, 1843. Grocery keeper in Harrison County in 1850. Merchant in Covington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 157B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, p. 681.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Grayson-Knott counties (Harrison County), Kentucky, Volume 12A, p. 243 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Hart E. Boswell (1815-1890)," Memorial 100461176, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100461176 (accessed March 25, 2020).
